capsules_submitted.utterance: You know, I've always been fascinated by Harry's story. He's truly the boy who lived, and it's amazing to think about all he went through at Hogwarts. I mean, can you imagine being famous in the wizarding world from birth just because of a lightning-shaped scar on your forehead? It's incredible how much pressure that must have put on him, but he always managed to rise above it.
capsules_submitted.reply: valeria, i think i trust you.

capsules_submitted.utterance: You know, I've always been fascinated by Harry's story. He's like a legend in his own right, "The Boy Who Lived" and all that. It's amazing how one person can have such an impact on the wizarding world. I mean, who wouldn't want to be famous for surviving a killing curse as a baby? (SENTIMENT: AWE)

You know, I've always been fascinated by Harry's story. He's like a symbol of hope for many people, especially in the wizarding world. The fact that he was destined to be "the boy who lived" is just incredible. It's no wonder he became so famous and revered among wizards and witches.

I think what really sets him apart is his willingness to put himself in harm's way time and time again to protect others. He's not afraid to face danger head-on, even when it means putting himself at risk. That kind of bravery is truly inspiring.

And let's be honest, who wouldn't want to be known as "the boy who lived"? It's like having a built-in superpower!
